Create API (Version 1.0)

This document is the iRobot Create API specification for use from Sun SPOT applications.

See:
          Description

Packages
org.sunspotworld.create The iRobot Create API for use from Sun SPOT applications.

 

This document is the iRobot Create API specification for use from Sun SPOT applications.

The iRobot Create is a small robot that can be controlled by a Sun SPOT. The low-level interface is described in the "Create Open Interface_v2.pdf" document found on the http://www.irobot.com site. It is recommended that you read this document in order to get a better understanding of how to work with the robot.

Sun SPOTs are small, wireless, Java-based devices being developed as a research effort at Sun Labs. They are programmed in Java using the APIs described in the SDK folder. Only the classes relating to the iRobot Create are described here. For more details on Sun SPOTs please visit http://www.sunspotworld.com.

Sun SPOT devices are based on the CLDC-compliant Squawk VM running directly on the metal. The goal of this project is to produce a flexible, reliable, easy-to-use Java platform for development, prototyping and deployment to small, wireless devices.

These libraries are a work-in-progress. While every attempt will be made to preserve compatibility, future releases will most likely not be backwards compatible.
